title: Lord Krishna in Sound Form: Chant with Reverence | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: But the basic principles needs repeated reminders again and again to understand nicely that how this is not an ordinary vibration.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of repeatedly reminding ourselves that the holy name is not an ordinary sound vibration.

segments.key_quote: And if proactively we don't teach our mind to perceive this sound as Krishna in his Shabda Vigraha, all Satchidananda Shabda Vigraha, if we don't teach our mind, as soon as we chant or hear Naama, we won't feel that reverence towards him, respect towards him, we will not feel.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that if we don't train our minds to perceive the holy name as Krishna Himself, we won't feel reverence or respect.

segments.key_quote: Krishna Naama is Krishna's incarnation. So how this mercy flows, that mechanism is also described by Srila Prabhupada through various analogies.
segments.summary: The speaker states that the holy name is Krishna's incarnation and that Srila Prabhupada explains how mercy flows from the name through analogies.

segments.key_quote: Chaitanya Charitamrita reveals that Krishna Naama is a Surya of Satchitananda... Existence, knowledge and bliss. It's an infinite source. Because that is Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna's name is the sun of eternity, knowledge and bliss, which is the natural atmosphere for the soul.

segments.key_quote: So soul is always incomplete in this material world. Therefore it is eternally it is hungry. Never satisfied... Just like our soul is like the piece of iron. We have to put in the fire of Satchitananda.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the soul is eternally hungry in the material world and uses the analogy of iron in fire to explain how chanting affects us.

segments.key_quote: Another example that Prabhupada gives is like the electrical wire. When electricity is not flowing through the wire it is a dead wire... Krishna Satchitananda Shakti is flowing in the sound you and me utter.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of an electrical wire to explain how Krishna's energy flows through the holy name and emphasizes that there is no difference between Krishna and His name.

segments.key_quote: Similarly the sound we utter is not the Shuddha Nama now. It is the incarnation of the Shakti of the Lord... First we associate with Shakti Avesha Nama... We are associating with the ocean of Sat Chit and Ananda energies.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concept of Shakti Avesha Nama and how associating with it cleanses the heart by replacing negative energies with positive ones.

segments.key_quote: Now our soul is like the piece of iron. It has to go into the fire... So if we want our soul to touch Sat Chit Ananda... You utter Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Ram Hare Ram Ram Ram Hare Hare Instantly The Lord is incarnating all his Shakti into it.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of hearing the holy name for transformation of the heart and soul, comparing it to putting iron in fire.

segments.key_quote: He has come for a purpose. He want to enter your heart... Thinking is the biggest enemy during japa. Any kind of thinking. Even philosophical thinking.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the purpose of the holy name is to enter our hearts and transform us, but thinking during japa hinders this process.

segments.key_quote: Uninterrupted hearing is extremely important... Chant Hare Krishna and exactly hear the same sound. Such a one statement is enough to change the world.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of uninterrupted hearing during japa and highlights Srila Prabhupada's instruction to chant and hear the same sound.

segments.key_quote: Mind is crazy. You need a power to hold the mind. To control the mind... Only Krishna can do it. That means the Shakti can come only from the nama.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the mind is naturally restless and that the power to control it comes from the mercy of the holy name.

segments.key_quote: First quality is depending upon hearing... Prabhupada has made it very easy. Just by chanting and hearing exactly the same sound... The shakti to keep away thinking is also there in this sound.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the quality of japa depends on hearing and that following Prabhupada's instruction provides the power to keep away thinking.

segments.key_quote: This has been practically demonstrated... Chant and hear exactly the same sound. This is the secret... The culprit is thinking.
segments.summary: The speaker shares a story demonstrating the power of chanting and hearing the holy name and identifies thinking as the main obstacle.

segments.key_quote: Simply let Prabhupada talk to you. Golden command... The only way He can enter into your heart if you allow by hearing.
segments.summary: The speaker encourages listeners to follow Prabhupada's golden command and allow the Lord to enter their hearts through hearing.

segments.key_quote: This analogy of Prabhupada's will bring lot of faith in us. That if I follow just like iron will get hot my chitta will get transformed... This sound is wanting relationship with us.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that following Prabhupada's analogy will bring faith and lead to transformation, emphasizing that the holy name desires a relationship with us.

segments.key_quote: Hearing does not mean concentration. Nothing. Simple hearing... You have to put effort to know the sound... It is a question of training.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that hearing is not about concentration but about knowing the sound and that it is a skill that can be trained.

segments.key_quote: One thing we have to have confidence, faith that it is not a herculean task... Bhakti Yoga is about association. Association with the holy name... Association is a secret.
segments.summary: The speaker encourages listeners to have confidence that learning to hear is not difficult and emphasizes the importance of association, especially with the holy name.

segments.key_quote: Krishna in his Namavatara is very merciful... So by cleansing our consciousness gradually we will be able to experience. We will be able to chant. Increase the quality of chanting.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the mercy of Krishna in His Namavatara and explains that cleansing our consciousness allows us to experience and improve the quality of our chanting.

segments.key_quote: That same Nama is there now also on our tongue when we chant... The key point I wanted to tell you is that the energy, enthusiasm to finish 100 rounds 200 rounds whatever rounds you want is coming from the Nama himself.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of rubber gloves to explain why we don't feel Krishna's presence on our tongue and reiterates that the energy for chanting comes from the holy name itself by following the golden command.

segments.key_quote: Thinking japa is like one rupee. Hearing japa is like one million rupees... It depends upon our how effectively we follow the simple golden command of Shri Prabhupada.
segments.summary: The speaker compares thinking japa to one rupee and hearing japa to one million rupees, emphasizing the importance of following Prabhupada's golden command effectively.

segments.key_quote: Tongue does not want to stop chanting. You want to continue more and more and more... Prabhupada was asked this particular question. Should we think of Krishna's pastime during japa? He said no just here.
segments.summary: The speaker shares that the tongue doesn't want to stop chanting when hearing japa is practiced and that Prabhupada instructed to just hear during japa.

segments.key_quote: Energy of chanting is coming from nama himself and don't try to not to think... To hear... Sound is Krishna. You have to catch the sound. That's all.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that the energy for chanting comes from the holy name and advises to focus on hearing the sound rather than trying not to think.

segments.key_quote: Tomorrow 64 rounds. I will explain... I put Prabhupada's that sound. Chant. Exactly. Chant Hare Krishna. Exactly same sound you hear.
segments.summary: The speaker announces the schedule for 64 rounds of chanting and explains how Prabhupada's voice will be used to guide the chanting.

segments.key_quote: Tomorrow what we will do is... I will prompt... Chant Hare Krishna. Exactly same sound you hear... Krishna himself is on your tongue. Like that some thoughts. Not thinking. Thoughts.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that he will prompt the audience to chant and hear the same sound and share faith-based thoughts to improve the quality of japa.
